item.title: Talking about change: Measuring change in longitudinal studies
item.description: A commonly encountered problem in longitudinal studies is that there are multiple ways that one can measure change. In a 2-wave study, one can either regress the change in $y$ on some variable, or regress $y_t$ on the variable while including $y_{t-1}$ as a covariate. For the purpose of this article, I’ll refer to the first method as the change score method, and the latter as the lagged dependent variable (LDV) method.

item.title: About
item.description: Welcome to the website of Joshua Pritsker. I’m an aspiring researcher interested in quantitative methods, with a special focus on developmental research. Research Interests Structural Equation Modeling / General Latent Variable Modeling Multivariate Longitudinal Models Parenting, child development Contact Email: joshpritsker@protonmail.com, jpritsk@purdue.edu GitHub: The-Sushi ORCiD: 0000-0001-9647-6684 Google Scholar: Joshua Pritsker OSF: Joshua Pritsker ResearchGate: Joshua Pritsker Twitter: JoshPritsker
